THAT\'S ON COOLDOWN!
GAME OVER!
The enemy steps over your corpse and proceeds to raid your village …
Peace returns to your people. The day is saved!
NO ONE WILL COME TO SAVE YOU!
LOUD NOISES!
We are a peaceful people. Please, stop this.
WAIT!!! NO!!! I\'M A VEGETARIAN!!!
I\'M SORRY!!! YOU CAN HAVE MY THINGS, JUST LET ME LIVE!!!
I\'VE HAD RASHES SCARIER THAN YOU!
No wrongs committed … what need is there for bloodshed?
Enough of your lies, beast! EN GUARDE!
Gorgol…a tiny Orcish village near where the Plains of Einaryl meet the grand Forest of Alstor-orah.
Tucked into the edge of the forest, the villagers have managed to isolate themselves from the outside world for generations, enjoying a peace quite unusual to Orckind.
Ever the fierce orcish warriors, the Gorgolans have always worked together to build up and secure their proud village (though any enemies lay in faraway lands and
whatever dangerous beasts may once have stalked the wilderness have long since been driven out or hunted to extinction by the old warriors and their proving rituals).
The Gorgolans of today may still sing the old songs, tell the old tales, and show off the old trophies, but each is more likely to be found wielding a hammer and nails

than a sword and shield, and not one would complain about the change. Water is plentiful, and though forest greens may never satisfy the rumbles of an orcish appetite, food is only ever a half-day\'s walk to the plains.
There, large roving herds of Aurochs roam, only occasionally interrupted by a band of Gorgolan hunters stocking up for their families before the herd rolls on.
Thusly does the wheel of life turn in this place, with little in the way to disturb it. There is nothing of material value here save to those who have grown
to love the place anyway. That is, until repeated wars strained the food stocks the neighboring kingdom of Aryndell to their limits. The people were starving,
so their rulers sought food…and found the Aurochs. Since then, ranches have begun to dot the once-quiet plains, moving ever closer to Gorgol and its sleepy citizens.
This turned the animals into a valuable commodity, and the humans of Aryndell into their self-proclaimed keepers.
Hunting them is now considered a punishable offense, endangering the livelihood and culture of the Gorgolans.
Harsh words and fences are hardly enough to keep an Orc from feeding his family, however. In their rage, the humans
have begun to send mercenaries to retaliate…and cut the problem at its source, if possible.
The eldest son of the Chief\'s line, you have taken up the old warmantle of your forbears.
Peace has been your life until now, but you are Umlaut, son of Enya the Stalwart, and you will protect your people.
Next Page
